text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/cf8441704d6e517bda1899f4afa82c6b4eecbaec|patch 8.2.1059: crash when using :tabonly in an autocommand>
patch 8.2.1059: crash when using :tabonly in an autocommand

Problem:    Crash when using :tabonly in an autocommand. (Yegappan Lakshmanan)
Solution:   Do not allow the autocommand window to be closed.

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1059: crash when using :tabonly in an autocommand · vim/vim@cf84417
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1059: crash when using :tabonly in an autocommand · vim/vim@cf84417
attachments.text: Problem: Crash when using :tabonly in an autocommand. (Yegappan Lakshmanan) Solution: Do not allow the autocommand window to be closed.

patch 8.2.1062: Vim9: no line break allowed inside "cond ? val1 : val2"

Problem:    Vim9: no line break allowed inside "cond ? val1 : val2".
Solution:   Check for operator after line break.

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/bd84617d1a6766efd59c94aabebb044bef805b99|patch 8.2.1066: Lua arrays are zero based>
patch 8.2.1066: Lua arrays are zero based

Problem:    Lua arrays are zero based.
Solution:   Make Lua arrays one based. (Prabir Shrestha, closes #6347)
            Note: this is not backwards compatible.

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1066: Lua arrays are zero based · vim/vim@bd84617
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1066: Lua arrays are zero based · vim/vim@bd84617
attachments.text: Problem: Lua arrays are zero based. Solution: Make Lua arrays one based. (Prabir Shrestha, closes #6347) Note: this is not backwards compatible.
